full_summary:
# Victoria Island Site Remediation Project Phase 3a

## Tender Notice

The National Capital Commission is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the site remediation of the greenspace area west of Portage Bridge, north of Middle Street on Victoria Island. The contractor will be responsible for the environmental site remediation, site reinstatement, and fencing removal/ installation.

## Description of Work

The scope of work includes:

* Excavation of contaminated soil and transportation to a Ministry of the Environment, Conservation and Parks approved disposal facility
* Segregation of clean soil for use in final backfill
* Protection and cleaning of the bedrock surface
* Site reinstatement with suitable soil backfill to specified grades
* Fencing removal and/or installation at various locations on the site

## Qualification Criteria
Bidders must meet the following qualification criteria:

* General Contractor's Qualification Statement / Company Profile must be completed in its entirety
* General Contractor's Experience and Client References must include one recent remediation project completed in the last seven years with a minimum remediation value of $2 million, including taxes
* Site Superintendent's Experience must have a minimum 10 years experience in the environmental/remediation industry, including 10 years experience in overall management of remediation projects
* Site Superintendent must have managed one remediation project with a cost of $2 million or greater (including taxes) within the last seven years

## Socio-Economic Benefits
This procurement aims to provide specific socio-economic benefits to Indigenous People and Indigenous Firms of the Algonquin Nation. Bidders are strongly encouraged to build an inclusive contracting team by contacting the Algonquin Nation and/or Algonquin companies to discuss and/or secure the participation of Algonquin companies in the work.

## Evaluation Criteria
The evaluation criteria include:

* Lowest compliant price (maximum 85 points)
* Algonquin participation (maximum 15 points)

## Tender Details
* Tender Reference Number: NR215
* Tender Closing Date: May 1, 2023 at 3:00 p.m. EDT
* Selection Criteria: Variations or combinations of the above methods
* Regions of Opportunity: National Capital Region (NCR)
* Contact Information: Micheline Al-Koutsi, Senior Contract Officer, micheline.al-koutsi@ncc-ccn.ca

## Attachments
Please visit [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca) for the tender package and attachments. Note:
